text:
Dubai Summer Surprises Visitors Enjoy Amazing Array Of Indoor and Outdoor Entertainment Published on : Thursday, August 20, 2015
One of the biggest incentives for families enjoying Dubai Summer Surprises is the scale and range of exciting indoor and outdoor entertainment that is on offer throughout the summer in the Emirate.
Outdoor attractions at locations like Wild Wadi or Aquaventure Waterpark at Atlantis, The Palm are two of the most popular locations for adrenaline fuelled thrills and spills coupled with the chance to spend the day cooling off in the water.
But malls across Dubai also provide a fantastic array of indoor entertainment offerings from the Magic Planet concept at Mall of the Emirates, City Centre Deira and City Centre Mirdif through to Sega Republic and Kidzania at The Dubai Mall.
The growing range and quality of the indoor and outdoor entertainment offering is playing a vital part in encouraging a larger number of visitors to come and enjoy what Dubai has to offer during the summer.
There is no doubt that with the range of what is on offer, Dubai is really geared up for the summer months and families are able to enjoy a fabulous mix of entertainment, shopping and eating out whether they are a local resident, regional or international visitor.
Experts believe that Dubai is now firmly at the forefront of the indoor entertainment industry in the Middle East and is set to significantly boost its retail and tourism segments in the future.
According to a recent study by Euro Monitor International, the market for theme parks in the UAE is expected to grow to over AED 3 billion by 2019 while the number of people visiting theme parks is forecasted to grow to 11.4 million.
Meanwhile, the management at local entertainment centres in Dubai are reporting a very strong performance this summer thanks to the positive impact of Dubai Summer Surprises.
Management at Wild Wadi are seeing an increase in summer visitor numbers with the majority coming from GCC countries like Saudi Arabia and Oman but with a relatively strong number from the UK and other EU countries.
One of the incentives this summer for visitors has been the #ExperienceWildWadi Virtual Reality Kiosk at The Dubai Mall where guests can get 25% off if they purchase their tickets from the stand and save money for their fun packed family day out at the water park.
Commenting on what the water park has to offer DSS visitors, Chris Swartz, Waterpark Manager said: “Wild Wadi (a Jumeirah property), with its unique location offering breathtaking views of Burj Al Arab Jumeirah, Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Madinat Jumeirah, offers something not available anywhere else in the world. With over 30 rides and attractions (13 of those interconnected), Wild Wadi guests experience more fun time while visiting.
“Combine all of that with the memorable experiences our dedicated colleagues help to create and the result is Dubai’s leading waterpark offering the ultimate in family fun experiences.”
Ravini Perera, Senior Vice President, Sales & Marketing at Atlantis, The Palm, said:
“Festivals such as Dubai Summer Surprises are an important and useful driver of tourism to the emirate. They help to further position Dubai as a holiday destination for the European market, Here at Atlantis, The Palm we see this particularly with regard to countries such as Germany, Italy and the UK.
“Occupancy has reached peak levels with families and holidaymakers coming to take advantage of not only the beach and sun, but the wide variety of entertainment activities available. At Atlantis, Aquaventure Waterpark is one of the favorite activities for holidaymakers.
“Special offers available during DSS include the “Taste The Fun Package” which includes park admission and meals from our waterpark dining outlets, which comprises of a wide variety of international cuisine from Asia, Italy, America, India and beyond, starting at AED 230 per adult / 205 child. Guests can also take advantage of the “Discovery Package” that covers admission and a meal at Aquaventure as well as entrance to the Lost Chambers Aquarium, our home to over 65,000 marine animals with prices starting at AED 305 per adult and AED 255 for children.”
